short_description: The function tags the part of speech of the input text.
long_description: Part of Speech tagging is an important preprocessing step in many natural language processing applications and the first step in the syntactic analysis of a language.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The input table that contains the input texts.
input_tables.description: The input table that contains the input texts.

argument_clauses.name: TextColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the text to be tagged.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the text to be tagged.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table. Note: If you intend to use the ta.postagger output table as input to the function "ta.textchunker", then this argument must specify the input table columns that comprise the partition key.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table. Note: If you intend to use the PosTagger output table as input to the function "TextChunker", then this argument must specify the input table columns that comprise the partition key.

argument_clauses.name: InputLanguage
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the language of the input text. The supported values are: en (English, the default value), zh_CN (Simplified Chinese)
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the language of the input text. The supported values are: en (English, the default value), zh_CN (Simplified Chinese)

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
